text: Melba Rae Toombs, known professionally as Melba Rae (October 7, 1917 in Willard, Utah – December 30, 1971 in Manhattan, was an American soap opera actress. ==Career== Rae was a key figure in early daytime television, playing the wife of the couple next door on Search for Tomorrow for 20 years — from its inception in 1951 until her untimely death of a cerebral hemorrhage at New York Hospital. Her character, Marge Bergman, was best friends with the main character of the series, Joanne (played by Mary Stuart). ==Personal life== Rae, a lifelong member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints http://www.ldsfilm.com/bio/bioR.html was married to Gilbert Shawn (1921 -- 2005) from September 2, 1955 until her death. The couple had a son and daughter. Their son, Eric Shawn, became a reporter for Fox News Channel. Gilbert Shawn moved to Orlando, Florida later in life, where he died at the age of 84.Shawn, Gilbert S. 2005-10-16 ==References== ==External links== * * https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70660588/melba-rae-shawn Category:American soap opera actresses Category:Actresses from Utah Category:1917 births Category:1971 deaths Category:American Latter Day Saints Category:20th-century American actresses Category:People from Willard, Utah
